summary:
Leaders in Spend Justification & Game Changers in Accounts Payable 

SpendLab Recovery is the Dutch market leader in spend justification. We are a former spin-off of the Dutch government with a 98 year old heritage in procurement. We are specialized in generating liquidity for clients by analyzing -and identifying anomalies in accounts payable data. We use leading-edge innovative algorithms fuelled by data science, technology and compliance standards to identify irregularities ("findings"). In addition, we provide Business Intelligence reports that are supported by expert professionals. 

Our innovative solutions, services and experts help businesses embrace technology. These solutions can be used to increase the accuracy, the auditability, the level of control and the efficiency of accounting, audit, assurance and compliance processes. By having insights in the raw data of the accounts payable and being able to recover unjustified liquidity, organizations will be able to identify and control (liquidity) risks in their vendor data. 

In terms of certification, SpendLab is GDPR compliant and is ISO-certified for Information Security Management (ISO/IEC 27001) and Quality Management (ISO 9001:2015).

projects.title: Traffic Management Crossroad Efficiency
projects.description:
Application of Design Thinking methodologies to improve the efficiency of traffic management at crossroads. 
Problem Statement: We identified a problem that is creating havoc in the day-to-day life of many Indian citizens - “Inefficient Crossroad Traffic Management”. Traffic congestion is a prevalent problem in various countries across the globe, but for our project, we limited our scope to India.

projects.title: Implementation of SMED (Single Minute Exchange of Die) on Power Press Machine
projects.description:
We worked for Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M), one of the largest vehicle manufacturers by production in India and the largest manufacturer of tractors in the world.
We increased the production efficiency for one of Mahindra's supplier 'Akar Industry' by applying one of the many lean production methods SMED (Single Minute Exchange of Die) on Power Press Machine.

profile_positions.description: As a key member of the large accounts team, focused on companies exceeding $1 billion in revenue, my primary responsibility at SpendLab is to drive service expansion in the EMEA and APAC regions. I take pride in assisting companies in uncovering and reclaiming millions in lost profits while enabling them to optimize their end-to-end procure-to-pay (P2P) processes. Leveraging our validated insights, we empower organizations to unlock significant financial gains and achieve operational excellence.
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Nyenrode was founded under the name of the Netherlands Training Institute for Abroad (NOIB in Dutch) by renowned private Dutch companies, including KLM, Shell, Unilever, Philips, and AkzoNobel with an objective- 'For Business, By Business'.

• I am working part-time at Nyenrode Business University in the Archiving office while completing my final course curriculum and thesis. This role consists of sorting out necessary documents of past IMBA, MSc, BSc, BScBA, and PGP batches. Additionally, it involves scanning, uploading, and managing these documents in order to make the whole system digitally available for future use. We follow a necessary transformative and sustainable model of recycling the unnecessary documents and files.
profile_positions.title: Archives Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Worked on Beauty & Personal Care Category to provide the company with new e-commerce marketing solutions under the guidance of Myrthe Van Erp (Category Manager at Unilever) and Laurens-Jan Duvigneau (eCommerce Lead at Unilever) and continuously received future-focused feedbacks from them which made me realize the importance Unilever puts on innovative thinking and on having a flexible mindset and culture.
• Additionally, I was involved in a strategic marketing consultancy project for Unilever. We helped solve the management problems by systematically thinking like a customer, performing market research, and finally proposing a customer loyalty program for the Zwitsal brand in order to enhance customer satisfaction and build strong customer relationships.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Student Consultant - Company Project

profile_positions.description:
• Increased the company’s sales by 16% through the implementation of an integrated guerrilla marketing, paid digital marketing (Google AdWords, Google Analytics, SEO, Email, etc.), and paid social media campaigns (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Quora, etc.).
• Gained 7K+ followers on IG account by executing user acquisition campaigns, optimizing website content, and creating best targeting by A/B testing various targeting metrics and creative ad copies
• Along with the product development team, applied customer-centric marketing, and utilized social media metrics to improve customer experience, which led to a reduction in churn rate by 10%. 
• Successfully collaborated with 10+ Colleges, 15+ Startups, 40+ Micro and Macro Influencers to expand the outreach to 3 different cities across India.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
JSW Steel is an Indian steel company owned by the JSW Group based in Mumbai, India. JSW Steel, after the merger of ISPAT steel, has become India's second-largest private sector steel company. A $13 billion conglomerate, with presence across India, USA, South America & Africa, the JSW Group is a part of the O.P. Jindal Group with strong footprints across core economic sectors, namely, Steel, Energy, Infrastructure, Cement, Ventures and Sports.

Received a rigorous Industrial/Vocational training on developing an understanding of the production line of a Steel Industry.

Learned how to optimize complex processes and organizations, and presented a student outlook of the process improvement methods and areas to the industry experts and senior management of JSW Steel.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Goodwill Tribe is a community based out of Dubai. We host community events and social experiments across the world, that brings people together in an experience designed for human connection and compassion.

1) I, as an Event specialist, help decide the format, the curation and the systematic execution of the events.
2) We have hosted community events and social experiments like:
•	Storytelling - Stories of freedom struggle, partition, and rehabilitation.
•	Letter Earthlings - Letters to cancer patients and survivors.
•	Heritage Walk - A stroll to some of the historical places in Nagpur.
3) We have impacted more than 5000 individuals through our unique way of organizing social experiments.

Yes Theory believes that life can be as fulfilling and authentic as you wish, so long as you’re willing to seek discomfort. We travel the world setting challenges for ourselves and for strangers and getting out of our comfort zones along the way, all in order to grow.

1) I helped strangers seek discomfort by helping them join our community just by performing out of the box tasks.
2) I helped promote the idea of getting out of one's comfort zones through the medium of social media and on-ground events.

Inner Planet is a psychotherapy firm that is focused on helping people improve their mental health. They coach you to let go of emotional baggage that slows you down in reaching your goals of success, efficiency, development or just running towards good old inner peace.

1) I, along with my team, designed and executed a psychology awareness campaign, ‘Alive’, to make people aware of the importance of mental health, a topic seldom discussed in the purview of health and well being. 
2) We collaborated with leading psychologists of Nagpur. We mentored them in the event space and they mentored us in the psychology space. Together, we worked on eradicating stigmas related to mental health, raised mental health awareness around stress and anxiety, so as to develop a city of well adjusted, rational, empowered, and productive individuals.
3) By curating and implementing these awareness campaigns we impacted more than 4000 individuals across the city of Nagpur (India).

The Climber is an IIM-B (a top B-school in India) incubated education company that was recognized by the United Nations SDSN as one of the top 50 youth-led solutions in the world.

1) Led the Nagpur chapter of the student body as an Executive board member and President by constantly looking and mentoring various departments including Marketing, Sales, and Business Development along with 120 volunteers to amplify the potential and raise the bar of the youth culture in Nagpur, India.
2) Mentored the VP - Marketing into cultivating youth engagement, following social media best practices, and to utilize the power of copywriting and content to optimize landing page performance, resulting in a combined online and offline community of 15,000 followers
3) Collaborated with a huge number of passion-driven organizations, artists, etc to bring in a change in the youth space.
4) Drove the team by implementing organizational tactics and by executing 7 youth events and 3 awareness campaigns.

Letters of Love in its last 3 years has delivered handwritten postcards to more than 30,000 Syrian, Iraqi, Yazidi, Palestinian and Rohingya refugee children and has also effectively mobilized more than 20,000 youth around the world, year after year. Due to the impact of our work, we've been identified and are an official member of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)  as well as the UN Sustainable Development Solutions Youth Network (SDSN).

1) I helped the organization set up its base in one of the cities of India (Nagpur).
2) I mentored the chapter lead in curating a fundraiser along with an event focusing on writing letters to the Syrian refugee children.

company.name: Shri Ramdeobaba Kamla Nehru Engineering College, Katol Road

volunteer_experiences.description:
Industrial Engineering Society is a student-led body based in Shri Ramdeobaba Kamla Nehru Engineering College. It helps share ideas, interests, and concerns with teachers and the Head of Department. 

I led a team of around 30 students and we together helped raise funds for department-wide activities, including social events, community projects, helped people in need, organized sessions by Industry experts and even looked after departmental reforms.
